New Records: White Sox set a new franchise record for losses in a season with 107
Post-Match Reflections: Garfien said, 'We're on this set to talk about winning games and I've only done it 31 times this year.'
Guillen said, 'At the end of the day, this is embarrassing.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The White Sox lost 2-0 to the New York Mets.
The 1970 White Sox went 56-106, setting the mark with a loss on the last day of the season, Oct. 1, 1970.
Chicago has only won six series all season but has now been swept 22 times.
Others: The team is 13-53 on the road.
The Sox are 3-17 under interim manager Grady Sizemore.
